name: src/js/shepherd.js
src/js/step.js
uniqueId
description: Creates incremented ID for each newly created step

return.description: The unique id for the step

name: Step
description: A class representing steps to be added to a tour.

params.name: tour
params.description: The tour for the step

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the step

params.name: options.attachTo
params.description:
What element the step should be attached to on the page.
It can either be a string of the form `[element] [on]` (where [element] is an element selector path):
```js
const new Step(tour, {
  attachTo: '.some .selector-path left',
  ...moreOptions,
})'
```
Or an object with those properties:
```js
const new Step(tour, {
  attachTo: { element: '.some .selector-path', on: 'left' },
  ...moreOptions
})'
```
If you use the object syntax, element can also be a DOM element. If you don’t specify an attachTo the
element will appear in the middle of the screen.

params.name: options.advanceOn
params.description:
An action on the page which should advance shepherd to the next step.
It can be of the form `"selector event"`:
```js
const new Step(tour, {
  advanceOn: '.some .selector-path click',
  ...moreOptions
})'
```
...or an object with those properties:
```js
const new Step(tour, {
  advanceOn: { selector: '.some .selector-path', event: 'click' },
  ...moreOptions
})'
```
`event` doesn’t have to be an event inside the tour, it can be any event fired on any element on the page.
You can also always manually advance the Tour by calling `myTour.next()`.

params.name: options.beforeShowPromise
params.description:
A function that returns a promise.
When the promise resolves, the rest of the `show` code for the step will execute.

params.name: options.buttons
params.description:
An array of buttons to add to the step. These will be rendered in a
footer below the main body text.

params.name: options.buttons.button.action
params.description: A function executed when the button is clicked on

params.name: options.buttons.button.classes
params.description: Extra classes to apply to the `<a>`

params.name: options.buttons.button.events
options.buttons.button.text
params.description: The HTML text of the button

params.name: options.classes
params.description: A string of extra classes to add to the step's content element.

params.name: options.highlightClass
params.description:
An extra class to apply to the `attachTo` element when it is
highlighted (that is, when its step is active). You can then target that selector in your CSS.

params.name: options.tippyOptions
params.description: Extra [options to pass to tippy.js]{@link https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/#all-options}

params.name: options.scrollTo
params.description: Should the element be scrolled to when this step is shown?

params.name: options.scrollToHandler
params.description:
A function that lets you override the default scrollTo behavior and
define a custom action to do the scrolling, and possibly other logic.

params.name: options.showCancelLink
params.description: Should a cancel “✕” be shown in the header of the step?

params.name: options.showOn
params.description:
A function that, when it returns `true`, will show the step.
If it returns false, the step will be skipped.

params.name: options.text
params.description:
The text in the body of the step. It can be one of four types:
```
- HTML string
- Array of HTML strings
- `HTMLElement` object
- `Function` to be executed when the step is built. It must return one of the three options above.
```

params.name: options.title
params.description: The step's title. It becomes an `h3` at the top of the step.

params.name: options.when

name: _addButtons
description: Adds buttons to the step as passed into options

params.name: content
params.description: The element for the step, to append the footer with buttons to

name: _addCancelLink
description: Adds the "x" button to cancel the tour

params.name: element
params.description: The step element

params.name: header
params.description: The header element for the step

name: _addContent
description: Adds text passed in as options

params.name: content
params.description: The content to append the text to

name: _createTooltipContent
description: Creates Shepherd element for step based on options

return.description: The DOM element for the step tooltip

name: getTour
description: Returns the tour for the step

name: cancel
description:
Cancel the tour
Triggers the `cancel` event

name: complete
description:
Complete the tour
Triggers the `complete` event

name: destroy
description:
Remove the step, delete the step's element, and destroy the tippy instance for the step
Triggers `destroy` event

name: hide
description: Hide the step and destroy the tippy instance

name: isOpen
description: Check if the step is open and visible

return.description: True if the step is open and visible

name: setupElements
description: Create the element and set up the tippy instance

name: scrollTo
description:
If a custom scrollToHandler is defined, call that, otherwise do the generic
scrollIntoView call.

name: setOptions
description: Sets the options for the step, maps `when` to events, sets up buttons

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the step

name: show
description: Wraps `_show` and ensures `beforeShowPromise` resolves before calling show

name: _show
description:
Triggers `before-show`, generates the tooltip DOM content,
sets up a tippy instance for the tooltip, then triggers `show`.

name: _updateStepTargetOnHide
description:
When a step is hidden, remove the highlightClass and 'shepherd-enabled'
and 'shepherd-target' classes

name: src/js/tour.js
uniqueId
description: Creates incremented ID for each newly created tour

return.description: The unique id for the tour

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the tour

params.name: options.defaultStepOptions
params.description: Default options for Steps ({@link Step#constructor}), created through `addStep`

params.name: options.steps
params.description: An array of Step instances to initialize the tour with

params.name: options.tourName
params.description:
An optional "name" for the tour. This will be appended to the the tour's
dynamically generated `id` property -- which is also set on the `body` element as the `data-shepherd-active-tour` attribute
whenever the tour becomes active.

params.name: options.useModalOverlay
params.description:
Whether or not steps should be placed above a darkened
modal overlay. If true, the overlay will create an opening around the target element so that it
can remain interactive

name: addStep
description: Adds a new step to the tour

params.name: arg1
params.description:
When arg2 is defined, arg1 can either be a string or number, to use for the `id` for the step
When arg2 is undefined, arg1 is either an object containing step options or a Step instance

params.name: arg2
params.description: An object containing step options or a Step instance

name: back
description: Go to the previous step in the tour

name: cancel
description:
Calls done() triggering the 'cancel' event
If `confirmCancel` is true, will show a window.confirm before cancelling

name: done
description: Called whenever the tour is cancelled or completed, basically anytime we exit the tour

params.name: event
params.description: The event name to trigger

name: getById
description: Gets the step from a given id

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the step to retrieve

name: isActive
description: Check if the tour is active

name: next
description:
Go to the next step in the tour
If we are at the end, call `complete`

name: removeStep
description: Removes the step from the tour

params.name: name
params.description: The id for the step to remove

params.name: stepOptions
params.description: The object describing the options for the step

params.name: name
params.description: The string or number to use as the `id` for the step

name: show
description: Show a specific step in the tour

params.name: key
params.description: The key to look up the step by

params.name: forward
params.description: True if we are going forward, false if backward

name: _styleTargetElementForStep
description:
Modulates the styles of the passed step's target element, based on the step's options and
the tour's `modal` option, to visually emphasize the element

params.name: step
params.description: The step object that attaches to the element

name: _skipStep
description: Called when `showOn` evaluates to false, to skip the step

params.name: step
params.description: The step to skip

params.name: forward
params.description: True if we are going forward, false if backward

name: _updateStateBeforeShow
description:
Before showing, hide the current step and if the tour is not
already active, call `this._setupActiveTour`.

name: _addBodyAttrs
description:
Adds the data-shepherd-active-tour attribute and the 'shepherd-active'
class to the body.

name: _removeBodyAttrs
description:
Removes the data-shepherd-active-tour attribute and the 'shepherd-active'
class from the body.

content: ## Shepherd **[Shepherd is maintained by Ship Shape. Contact us for Ember.js consulting, development, and training for your project](https://shipshape.io/ember-consulting/)**. [![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/shepherd.js.svg)](http://badge.fury.io/js/shepherd.js) ![Download count all time](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/shepherd.js.svg) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/shepherd.js.svg)]() [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/shipshapecode/shepherd.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/shipshapecode/shepherd) [![Maintainability](https://api.codeclimate.com/v1/badges/b295b0cc0d828ccc1b76/maintainability)](https://codeclimate.com/github/shipshapecode/shepherd/maintainability) [![Test Coverage](https://api.codeclimate.com/v1/badges/b295b0cc0d828ccc1b76/test_coverage)](https://codeclimate.com/github/shipshapecode/shepherd/test_coverage) [![Greenkeeper badge](https://badges.greenkeeper.io/shipshapecode/shepherd.svg)](https://greenkeeper.io/) [![Guide your users through a tour of your app](/docs/assets/img/intro-step.png)](https://shipshapecode.github.io/shepherd/docs/welcome/) Installation ---------------------------------------------------------- ### JS Framework Wrappers We strive to make it easy to use Shepherd in all the major frameworks, and have written wrappers to facilitate this. * [angular-shepherd](https://github.com/shipshapecode/angular-shepherd) * [ember-shepherd](https://github.com/shipshapecode/ember-shepherd) * [react-shepherd](https://github.com/shipshapecode/react-shepherd) * [vue-shepherd](https://github.com/shipshapecode/vue-shepherd) ### Install Directly __Dependencies__ * __[Tippy.js](https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/)__ Installing via `npm` will bring in the above dependencies as well. __npm__ ```bash npm install shepherd.js --save ``` __yarn__ ```bash yarn add shepherd.js ``` Usage ---------------------------------------------------------- ```javascript let tour = new Shepherd.Tour({ defaultStepOptions: { classes: 'shadow-md bg-purple-dark', scrollTo: true } }); tour.addStep('example', { title: 'Example Shepherd', text: 'Creating a Shepherd is easy too! Just create ...', attachTo: '.hero-example bottom', advanceOn: '.docs-link click' }); tour.start(); ``` Documentation ---------------------------------------------------------- [API documentation](https://shipshapecode.github.io/shepherd/esdoc/) Demo ---------------------------------------------------------- [Demo](https://shipshapecode.github.io/shepherd/docs/welcome/) Contributing ---------------------------------------------------------- We encourage contributions of all kinds. If you would like to contribute in some way, please review our [guidelines for contributing](CONTRIBUTING.md). License ---------------------------------------------------------- [MIT License](LICENSE)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "shepherd.js",
  "version": "2.8.0",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/shipshapecode/shepherd.git"
  },
  "description": "Guide your users through a tour of your app.",
  "keywords": [
    "site tour",
    "tour",
    "tutorial",
    "shepherd"
  ],
  "authors": [
    "Adam Schwartz <adam.flynn.schwartz@gmail.com>",
    "Zack Bloom <zackbloom@gmail.com>"
  ],
  "maintainers": [
    "Nicholas Hwang <nick.joosung.hwang@gmail.com>",
    "Geoff Daigle <geoffreydaigle@gmail.com>",
    "Robert Wagner <rwwagner90@gmail.com>",
    "Chuck Carpenter <charleswcarpenter3@gmail.com>"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "build": "yarn clean && rollup -c",
    "esdoc": "esdoc",
    "clean": "rm -rf dist",
    "cy:open": "./node_modules/.bin/cypress open",
    "cy:run": "./node_modules/.bin/cypress run",
    "rewrite-paths": "replace 'SF:.*src' 'SF:src' coverage/lcov.info",
    "start": "yarn watch",
    "start-test-server": "http-server -p 9002",
    "test": "yarn test:ci",
    "test:ci": "yarn test:unit:ci && yarn test:cy:ci",
    "test:cy:ci": "yarn build && start-server-and-test start-test-server http://localhost:9002 cy:run",
    "test:cy:watch": "yarn build && start-server-and-test start-test-server http://localhost:9002 cy:open",
    "test:unit:ci": "jest --coverage",
    "test:unit:watch": "jest --watch",
    "view-coverage": "http-server -p 9003 ./coverage/lcov-report -o",
    "watch": "yarn clean && rollup -c --environment DEVELOPMENT --watch"
  },
  "homepage": "https://shipshapecode.github.io/shepherd/docs/welcome/",
  "license": "MIT",
  "main": "dist/js/shepherd.js",
  "module": "dist/js/shepherd.esm.js",
  "dependencies": {
    "element-matches": "^0.1.2",
    "lodash.defer": "^4.1.0",
    "lodash.iselement": "^4.1.1",
    "lodash.isobjectlike": "^4.0.0",
    "lodash.zipobject": "^4.1.3",
    "tippy.js": "^4.3.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.4.4",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.4.4",
    "autoprefixer": "^9.5.1",
    "babel-core": "^7.0.0-bridge.0",
    "babel-jest": "^24.7.1",
    "babel-plugin-transform-es2015-modules-commonjs": "^6.26.2",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "codeclimate-test-reporter": "^0.5.1",
    "cssnano": "^4.1.10",
    "cypress": "^3.2.0",
    "del": "^4.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.16.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jest": "^22.5.1",
    "eslint-plugin-ship-shape": "^0.6.0",
    "glob": "^7.1.3",
    "http-server": "^0.11.1",
    "jest": "^24.7.1",
    "jest-dom": "^3.1.4",
    "jest-expect-message": "^1.0.2",
    "jest-transform-css": "^2.0.0",
    "mutationobserver-shim": "^0.3.3",
    "postcss": "^7.0.14",
    "replace": "^1.1.0",
    "rollup": "^1.11.0",
    "rollup-plugin-analyzer": "^3.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^4.3.2",
    "rollup-plugin-browsersync": "^1.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^9.3.4",
    "rollup-plugin-css-only": "^1.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-eslint": "^5.1.0",
    "rollup-plugin-filesize": "^6.0.1",
    "rollup-plugin-license": "^0.8.1",
    "rollup-plugin-multi-entry": "^2.1.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^4.2.3",
    "rollup-plugin-sass": "^1.2.2",
    "rollup-plugin-stylelint": "^0.0.4",
    "rollup-plugin-terser": "^4.0.4",
    "rollup-plugin-visualizer": "^1.1.1",
    "sinon": "^7.3.2",
    "start-server-and-test": "^1.9.0",
    "stylelint": "^10.0.1",
    "stylelint-config-ship-shape": "^0.5.2"
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": ">= 6.*"
  }
}
